title: 109_s267
content: The Act is titled the "Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2005" and reauthorizes the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments to various sections changing the expiration dates to 2013 and 2014. Additionally, the authority to resume receipt of 25- or 50-percent payments is modified. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments allowing counties to elect to receive 25-percent payments starting from fiscal year 2007. Additionally, 50-percent payments are also modified for fiscal year 2013. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments allowing counties to elect to receive 25-percent payments starting from fiscal year 2007. Payments from national forest lands are clarified to include trust funds and permanent funds. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments allowing counties to receive payments from national forest lands. If a shortfall is expected for a fiscal year, all revenues received during that year will be reserved for payments under this section. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments allowing counties to receive payments from national forest lands. If a shortfall is likely for a fiscal year, all revenues received during that year will be reserved for payments under this section. Amendments also allow for reappointment of resource advisory committee members. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments allowing counties to receive payments from national forest lands. Amendments also allow for reappointment of resource advisory committee members. Section 1803(c) of Food and Agriculture Act of 1977 shall not apply to a resource advisory committee established by the Secretary of Agriculture. Section 204(e)(3) is revised to allow the Secretary concerned to establish a pilot program at the request of a resource advisory committee. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments allowing counties to receive payments from national forest lands. Amendments also allow for reappointment of resource advisory committee members. Notification and reporting requirements regarding county projects are added, with specific timelines for notification. The participating county must notify the Secretary concerned within 90 days after the fiscal year ends about projects where county funds were used. The notification should include project details, authorized use, and the amount of county funds spent. The Secretary concerned will review the notifications submitted for each fiscal year. The Secretary concerned will review notifications submitted by participating counties for each fiscal year to assess their success in achieving the purposes of the title. An annual report will be prepared with the review results and a summary of the notifications, to be submitted to specific Senate and House committees within 150 days after the end of the fiscal year. The term 'Secretary concerned' is defined as the Secretary of Agriculture or the Secretary of the Interior, or their designees, with respect to county funds reserved for expenditure in accordance with the title. In a technical correction, the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to replace "An eligible county" with "A participating county" in paragraphs (1), (2), and (3), and to replace "A county" with "A participating county" in paragraphs (4), (5), and (6). Additionally, a comma is removed after "the Secretary concerned may" in Section 205(a)(3).
